cadPCMIB.name: cadPCMIB

revisions.description: Replace cerCardId with cadPCCardId in cadPCCAMEntry. Replace cerCardId with cadPCConnRateOverloadRejCardId in cadPCConnRateOverloadRejEntry.
Removed cadPCAuthModuleEnabled. No longer needed in R7.0. For I-CMTS, added cadPCCAMCblMacTable for populating 12U cards
Move from cadExperimental tree to cadCable in the hierarchy
Add admission control for PacketCable MultiMedia.
For bug 68227, added gateReportState to CadPCGateCtlCountEntry opcodes. Steve Nolle
Add MIB entries for improved deployment troubleshooting (phase 1)

Obsoleting cadPCMaxOverloadCalls, cadPCMaxYellowOverloadCalls, and cadPCMaxRedOverloadCalls and replacing them with cadPCMaxOverloadGateMsgs, cadPCMaxYellowOverloadGateMsgs, and cadPCMaxRedOverloadGateMsgs.
Change defaults to match those in down/up channel mibs.
Rename some variables to support setting channel default values from the global settings.
Add cadPCMaxRedOverloadDSaCalls, cadPCMaxYellowOverloadDSaCalls, and cadPCMaxOverloadDSaCalls -- by Brian Barker
Add cadPCMaxRedOverloadCalls, cadPCMaxYellowOverloadCalls, and cadPCMaxOverloadCalls -- by Steve Nolle
Put cadPCAuthModuleEnabled into a table to make it per-CAM

cadPCMIB.description: PacketCable general-purpose management MIB. This MIB contains objects which are specific to PacketCable but not covered in any of the more-specialized MIBS.

CadPCAnomalyCode.name: CadPCAnomalyCode
CadPCAnomalyCode.description: Corresponds to the PacketCable Reason and PacketCable Error codes documented in PKT-SP-DQOS-I06-030415. To get index for PacketCable Error, mask off the low-order 16-bit Error Sub-code. The PacketCable Reasons match the combination Reason-Code and Reason Sub-code. Normal operation is not pegged and therefor is not included below.

CadPCAdmCtlPriority.name: CadPCAdmCtlPriority
CadPCAdmCtlPriority.description: Symbolic description of CAC priority levels for PacketCable sessions. Note that the MIB values are one greater than the Session Class priority values defined in the PacketCable MultiMedia Specification.

cadPCPreemptionAllowed.name: cadPCPreemptionAllowed
cadPCPreemptionAllowed.description: Indicates whether the system will preempt another session for an emergency call.

cadPCUpNormAllowedUsage.name: cadPCUpNormAllowedUsage
cadPCUpNormAllowedUsage.reference: Cadant CMTS Requirements for PacketCable requirement 3.3.3.0.2
cadPCUpNormAllowedUsage.description: Maximum percentage of upstream resources that may be used by non-emergency telephony services. This is also the maximum amount of resources non-exclusively allocated to sessions of this type

cadPCUpNormResUsage.name: cadPCUpNormResUsage
cadPCUpNormResUsage.description: Minimum percentage of upstream resources that may be used by non-emergency telephony services. This is also the maximum amount of resources exclusively allocated to sessions of this type. If the value of this object is non-zero, then a portion of the upstream bandwidth will be set aside for normal telephony use only - reducing the bandwidth that is available for normal data.

cadPCUpEmerAllowedUsage.name: cadPCUpEmerAllowedUsage
cadPCUpEmerAllowedUsage.reference: Cadant CMTS Requirements for PacketCable requirement 3.3.3.0.2
cadPCUpEmerAllowedUsage.description: Maximum percentage of upstream resources that may be used by emergency telephony services.

cadPCUpEmerResUsage.name: cadPCUpEmerResUsage
cadPCUpEmerResUsage.description: Minimum percentage of upstream resources that may be used by emergency telephony services. If the value of this object is non-zero, then a portion of the upstream bandwidth will be set aside for emercency telephony use only - reducing the bandwidth that is available for normal data.

cadPCDownNormAllowedUsage.name: cadPCDownNormAllowedUsage
cadPCDownNormAllowedUsage.description: Maximum percentage of downstream resources that may be used by non-emergency telephony services. This is also the maximum amount of resources non-exclusively allocated to sessions of this type

cadPCDownNormResUsage.name: cadPCDownNormResUsage
cadPCDownNormResUsage.description: Minimum percentage of downstream resources that may be used by non-emergency telephony services. This is also the maximum amount of resources exclusively allocated to sessions of this type. If the value of this object is non-zero, then a portion of the upstream bandwidth will be set aside for normal telephony use only - reducing the bandwidth that is available for normal data.

cadPCDownEmerAllowedUsage.name: cadPCDownEmerAllowedUsage
cadPCDownEmerAllowedUsage.description: Maximum percentage of downstream resources that may be used by emergency telephony services.

cadPCDownEmerResUsage.name: cadPCDownEmerResUsage
cadPCDownEmerResUsage.description: Minimum percentage of downstream resources that may be used by emergency telephony services. If the value of this object is non-zero, then a portion of the upstream bandwidth will be set aside for normal telephony use only - reducing the bandwidth that is available for normal data.

cadPCCAMTable.name: cadPCCAMTable
cadPCCAMTable.description: Table of Per-CAM PacketCable Data for 2D12U only

cadPCCAMEntry.name: cadPCCAMEntry
cadPCCAMEntry.description: This entry contains all of the PacketCable data that is to be managed on a per-CAM basis.

cadFreeDSxAllowed.name: cadFreeDSxAllowed
cadFreeDSxAllowed.description: Indicates whether the authorization module will allow a DOCSIS MAC Messaging Dynamic Services request (DSx) without a gate-ID in an authorization block.

cadPCMaxOverloadDSaCalls.name: cadPCMaxOverloadDSaCalls
cadPCMaxOverloadDSaCalls.description: the max number of connections we will allow per 10 second interval when the system cpu is in a normal condition, i.e. no overload.

cadPCMaxYellowOverloadDSaCalls.name: cadPCMaxYellowOverloadDSaCalls
cadPCMaxYellowOverloadDSaCalls.description: the max number of connections we will allow per 10 second interval when the system cpu is in a yellow overload condition.

cadPCMaxRedOverloadDSaCalls.name: cadPCMaxRedOverloadDSaCalls
cadPCMaxRedOverloadDSaCalls.description: the max number of connections we will allow per 10 second interval when the system cpu is in a red overload condition.

cadPCCardId.name: cadPCCardId
cadPCCardId.description: The unique id of this card within the shelf.

cadPCAdminState.name: cadPCAdminState
cadPCAdminState.description: The administrative state of PacketCable services on the CMTS.

cadPCMaxOverloadCalls.name: cadPCMaxOverloadCalls
cadPCMaxOverloadCalls.description: the max number of connections we will allow per 10 second interval when the system cpu is in a normal condition, i.e. no overload.

cadPCMaxYellowOverloadCalls.name: cadPCMaxYellowOverloadCalls
cadPCMaxYellowOverloadCalls.description: the max number of connections we will allow per 10 second interval when the system cpu is in a yellow overload condition.

cadPCMaxRedOverloadCalls.name: cadPCMaxRedOverloadCalls
cadPCMaxRedOverloadCalls.description: the max number of connections we will allow per 10 second interval when the system cpu is in a red overload condition.

cadPCDownTotalAllowedUsage.name: cadPCDownTotalAllowedUsage
cadPCDownTotalAllowedUsage.description: Maximum percentage of downstream resources that may be used by both normal and emergency telephony services.

cadPCUpTotalAllowedUsage.name: cadPCUpTotalAllowedUsage
cadPCUpTotalAllowedUsage.description: Maximum percentage of upstream resources that may be used by both normal and emergency telephony services.

cadPCMaxOverloadGateMsgs.name: cadPCMaxOverloadGateMsgs
cadPCMaxOverloadGateMsgs.description: the max number of gate messages that the system will process per 10 second interval when the system cpu is in a normal condition, i.e. no overload.

cadPCMaxYellowOverloadGateMsgs.name: cadPCMaxYellowOverloadGateMsgs
cadPCMaxYellowOverloadGateMsgs.description: the max number of gate messages that the system will process per 10 second interval when the system cpu is in a yellow overload condition.

cadPCMaxRedOverloadGateMsgs.name: cadPCMaxRedOverloadGateMsgs
cadPCMaxRedOverloadGateMsgs.description: the max number of gate messages that the system will process per 10 second interval when the system cpu is in a red overload condition.

cadPCClearGateCounts.name: cadPCClearGateCounts
cadPCClearGateCounts.description: set to true to clear the gate counts, always false when read

cadPCClearAnomalyCounts.name: cadPCClearAnomalyCounts
cadPCClearAnomalyCounts.description: set to true to clear the anomaly counts, always false when read

cadPCClearConnRateOverloadCounts.name: cadPCClearConnRateOverloadCounts
cadPCClearConnRateOverloadCounts.description: set to true to clear the connection rate overload counts, always false when read

cadPCClearEvMsgCounts.name: cadPCClearEvMsgCounts
cadPCClearEvMsgCounts.description: set to true to clear the event messaging counts, always false when read

cadPCClearCopsCounts.name: cadPCClearCopsCounts
cadPCClearCopsCounts.description: set to true to clear the COPS counts, always false when read

cadPCClearGateCtlCounts.name: cadPCClearGateCtlCounts
cadPCClearGateCtlCounts.description: set to true to clear the gate control counts, always false when read

cadPCTotalGateCount.name: cadPCTotalGateCount
cadPCTotalGateCount.reference: 'C4 Product Specification Agreement: PacketCable Deployment Tools on the C4 CMTS' requirement 2.3.1.2-30
cadPCTotalGateCount.description: Total number of gates that have been created since the last reboot of the system or since the last time that this counter was manually reset.

cadPCGateAllocatedStateCount.name: cadPCGateAllocatedStateCount
cadPCGateAllocatedStateCount.reference: 'C4 Product Specification Agreement: PacketCable Deployment Tools on the C4 CMTS' requirement 2.3.1.2-40
cadPCGateAllocatedStateCount.description: Total number of gates that are currently in the ALLOCATED state

cadPCGateAuthorizedStateCount.name: cadPCGateAuthorizedStateCount
cadPCGateAuthorizedStateCount.reference: 'C4 Product Specification Agreement: PacketCable Deployment Tools on the C4 CMTS' requirement 2.3.1.2-40
cadPCGateAuthorizedStateCount.description: Total number of gates that are currently in the AUTHORIZED state

cadPCGateReservedStateCount.name: cadPCGateReservedStateCount
cadPCGateReservedStateCount.reference: 'C4 Product Specification Agreement: PacketCable Deployment Tools on the C4 CMTS' requirement 2.3.1.2-40
cadPCGateReservedStateCount.description: Total number of gates that are currently in the RESERVED state

cadPCGateCommittedStateCount.name: cadPCGateCommittedStateCount
cadPCGateCommittedStateCount.reference: 'C4 Product Specification Agreement: PacketCable Deployment Tools on the C4 CMTS' requirement 2.3.1.2-40
cadPCGateCommittedStateCount.description: Total number of gates that are currently in the COMMITTED state

cadPCGateLastCleared.name: cadPCGateLastCleared
cadPCGateLastCleared.description: The value of sysUptime when the gate counts were last cleared.

cadPCAnomalyCountTable.name: cadPCAnomalyCountTable
cadPCAnomalyCountTable.reference: 'C4 Product Specification Agreement: PacketCable Deployment Tools on the C4 CMTS' requirement 2.3.1.2-50

cadPCAnomalyCode.name: cadPCAnomalyCode
cadPCAnomalyCode.reference: 'C4 Product Specification Agreement: PacketCable Deployment Tools on the C4 CMTS' requirement 2.3.1.2-50

cadPCAnomalyCount.name: cadPCAnomalyCount
cadPCAnomalyCount.reference: 'C4 Product Specification Agreement: PacketCable Deployment Tools on the C4 CMTS' requirement 2.3.1.2-50
cadPCAnomalyCount.description: Count of anomalies of the corresponding type that have occurred since boot or since the last manual reset of this count.

cadPCAnomalyLastCleared.name: cadPCAnomalyLastCleared
cadPCAnomalyLastCleared.description: The value of sysUptime when the anomaly counts were last cleared.

cadPCSendSubId.name: cadPCSendSubId
cadPCSendSubId.description: Indicates whether the C4 will send a subscriber ID in every DQoS gate-open and gate-close message. This is provisioned per-CMTS. ECN DQOS1.5-N-06.0339-4

cadPCConnRateReqHistoryTable.name: cadPCConnRateReqHistoryTable
cadPCConnRateReqHistoryTable.reference: 'C4 Product Specification Agreement: PacketCable Deployment Tools on the C4 CMTS' requirement 2.3.1.2-60, 2.3.1.2-65
cadPCConnRateReqHistoryTable.description: Table of connection request rate history

cadPCConnRateReqHistoryTimeStamp.name: cadPCConnRateReqHistoryTimeStamp
cadPCConnRateReqHistoryTimeStamp.reference: 'C4 Product Specification Agreement: PacketCable Deployment Tools on the C4 CMTS' requirement 2.3.1.2-60, 2.3.1.2-65
cadPCConnRateReqHistoryTimeStamp.description: Value of sysUpTime (rounded down to the nearest second) when this entry was created

cadPCConnRateReqHistoryCount.name: cadPCConnRateReqHistoryCount
cadPCConnRateReqHistoryCount.reference: 'C4 Product Specification Agreement: PacketCable Deployment Tools on the C4 CMTS' requirement 2.3.1.2-60, 2.3.1.2-65
cadPCConnRateReqHistoryCount.description: Count of connection requests (gates) made during the second

cadPCConnReqMaxHistRate.name: cadPCConnReqMaxHistRate
cadPCConnReqMaxHistRate.reference: 'C4 Product Specification Agreement: PacketCable Deployment Tools on the C4 CMTS' requirement 2.3.1.2-60
cadPCConnReqMaxHistRate.description: Maximum value of any cadPCConnReqRateCount since system boot or reset of this value.

cadPCConnRateOverloadRejTable.name: cadPCConnRateOverloadRejTable
cadPCConnRateOverloadRejTable.reference: 'C4 Product Specification Agreement: PacketCable Deployment Tools on the C4 CMTS' requirement 2.3.1.2-70
cadPCConnRateOverloadRejTable.description: Table of Per-card rate overload reject connection counts

cadPCConnRateOverloadRejEntry.name: cadPCConnRateOverloadRejEntry
cadPCConnRateOverloadRejEntry.description: This entry contains the connection rate overload rejection counts.

cadPCConnRateOverloadRejCount.name: cadPCConnRateOverloadRejCount
cadPCConnRateOverloadRejCount.reference: 'C4 Product Specification Agreement: PacketCable Deployment Tools on the C4 CMTS' requirement 2.3.1.2-70
cadPCConnRateOverloadRejCount.description: Number of connections that have been rejected as a result of rate overload protection while the system is in the corresponding system-wide overload state since the last system reboot or since the last time that this counter was reset.

cadPCConnRateOverloadRejCardId.name: cadPCConnRateOverloadRejCardId
cadPCConnRateOverloadRejCardId.description: The unique id of this card within the shelf.

cadPCConnRateOverloadLastCleared.name: cadPCConnRateOverloadLastCleared
cadPCConnRateOverloadLastCleared.description: The value of sysUptime when the connection rate overload counts were last cleared.

cadPCEvMsgCountTable.name: cadPCEvMsgCountTable
cadPCEvMsgCountTable.description: Table of counts of event messages that have been transmitted to each RKS or DF (for Electronic Surveillance Call Data) server

cadPCEvMsgCountEntry.name: cadPCEvMsgCountEntry
cadPCEvMsgCountEntry.description: This entry contains counts of event messages that have been transmitted

cadPCEvMsgCountServer.name: cadPCEvMsgCountServer
cadPCEvMsgCountServer.description: IP address of RKS or DF server

cadPCEvMsgServerIsDF.name: cadPCEvMsgServerIsDF
cadPCEvMsgServerIsDF.reference: 'C4 Product Specification Agreement: PacketCable Deployment Tools on the C4 CMTS' requirement 2.3.1.2-100
cadPCEvMsgServerIsDF.description: Indicator of type of server. Set to true(1) if server is a delivery function server.

cadPCEvMsgType.name: cadPCEvMsgType
cadPCEvMsgType.reference: 'PacketCable Event Messages Specification: PKT-SP-EM-I07-030815'; 'C4 Product Specification Agreement: PacketCable Deployment Tools on the C4 CMTS' requirement 2.3.1.2-100
cadPCEvMsgType.description: Type of message being counted. These map directly to the event message opcodes in the Event Messaging reference

cadPCEvMsgCount.name: cadPCEvMsgCount
cadPCEvMsgCount.reference: 'C4 Product Specification Agreement: PacketCable Deployment Tools on the C4 CMTS' requirement 2.3.1.2-100
cadPCEvMsgCount.description: Count of rejected connections due to channel bandwidth congestion since boot or since the last manual reset of this count.

cadPCEvMsgCountLastCleared.name: cadPCEvMsgCountLastCleared
cadPCEvMsgCountLastCleared.description: The value of sysUptime when the event messaging counts were last cleared.

cadPCCopsCountTable.name: cadPCCopsCountTable
cadPCCopsCountTable.description: Table of counts of event messages that have been sent to or received from each server.

cadPCCopsCountEntry.name: cadPCCopsCountEntry
cadPCCopsCountEntry.description: This entry contains counts of COPS messages.

cadPCCopsServer.name: cadPCCopsServer
cadPCCopsServer.description: IP address of CMS or PS server

cadPCCopsDirection.name: cadPCCopsDirection
cadPCCopsDirection.description: direction of message flow from viewpoint of the CMTS

cadPCCopsOpcode.name: cadPCCopsOpcode
cadPCCopsOpcode.reference: 'The COPS (Common Open Policy Service) Protocol: RFC2748'; 'C4 Product Specification Agreement: PacketCable Deployment Tools on the C4 CMTS' requirement 2.3.1.2-110
cadPCCopsOpcode.description: Type of message being counted. These map directly to the COPS opcodes in RFC 2748.

cadPCCopsCount.name: cadPCCopsCount
cadPCCopsCount.reference: 'C4 Product Specification Agreement: PacketCable Deployment Tools on the C4 CMTS' requirement 2.3.1.2-110

cadPCCopsCountLastCleared.name: cadPCCopsCountLastCleared
cadPCCopsCountLastCleared.description: The value of sysUptime when the COPS counts were last cleared.

cadPCGateCtlCountTable.name: cadPCGateCtlCountTable
cadPCGateCtlCountTable.description: Table of counts of event messages that have been sent to or received from each server.

cadPCGateCtlCountEntry.name: cadPCGateCtlCountEntry
cadPCGateCtlCountEntry.description: This entry contains counts of gate control messages.

cadPCGateCtlOpcode.name: cadPCGateCtlOpcode
cadPCGateCtlOpcode.reference: 'PacketCable Dynamic Quality of Service Specification: PKT-SP-DQOS-I07-0300815'; 'C4 Product Specification Agreement: PacketCable Deployment Tools on the C4 CMTS' requirement 2.3.1.2-120
cadPCGateCtlOpcode.description: Type of message being counted. These map directly to the gate command type opcodes in the DQoS spec.

cadPCGateCtlCount.name: cadPCGateCtlCount
cadPCGateCtlCount.reference: 'C4 Product Specification Agreement: PacketCable Deployment Tools on the C4 CMTS' requirement 2.3.1.2-120
cadPCGateCtlCount.description: Count of messages since boot or since the last manual reset of this count.

cadPCGateCtlCountLastCleared.name: cadPCGateCtlCountLastCleared
cadPCGateCtlCountLastCleared.description: The value of sysUptime when the gate control counts were last cleared.

cadPCDefAdmCtlTable.name: cadPCDefAdmCtlTable
cadPCDefAdmCtlTable.description: Table of Per-Priority PacketCable admission control policies

cadPCDefAdmCtlEntry.name: cadPCDefAdmCtlEntry
cadPCDefAdmCtlEntry.description: This entry contains all of the default PacketCable admission policy data.

cadPCDefAdmCtlDirection.name: cadPCDefAdmCtlDirection
cadPCDefAdmCtlDirection.description: Direction for this default policy data.

cadPCDefAdmCtlPriority.name: cadPCDefAdmCtlPriority
cadPCDefAdmCtlPriority.description: Priority value assigned to this row.

cadPCDefAdmCtlAllowedUsage.name: cadPCDefAdmCtlAllowedUsage
cadPCDefAdmCtlAllowedUsage.description: Maximum percentage of resources that may be used by requests at the corresponding priority level. This is also the maximum amount of resources non-exclusively allocated to sessions of this type

cadPCDefAdmCtlReservedUsage.name: cadPCDefAdmCtlReservedUsage
cadPCDefAdmCtlReservedUsage.description: Minimum percentage of resources that may be used by requests at the corresponding priority level. This is also the maximum amount of resources exclusively allocated to sessions of this type. If the value of this object is non-zero, then a portion of the bandwidth will be set aside for this priority only - reducing the bandwidth that is available for normal data.

cadPC1xAdmCtlMapTable.name: cadPC1xAdmCtlMapTable
cadPC1xAdmCtlMapTable.description: Table of mappings of PacketCable 1.x to PacketCable Multimedia admission control policies

cadPC1xAdmCtlMapEntry.name: cadPC1xAdmCtlMapEntry
cadPC1xAdmCtlMapEntry.description: This entry contains mapping of one PacketCable 1.x admission policy to a PacketCable Multimedia policy.

cadPCAdmCtlMapPriority.name: cadPCAdmCtlMapPriority
cadPCAdmCtlMapPriority.description: PacketCable Multimedia Priority value assigned to this row.

cadPCInterfaceAdmCtlTable.name: cadPCInterfaceAdmCtlTable
cadPCInterfaceAdmCtlTable.description: Table of Per-Priority PacketCable admission control policies. There exists a row per cable downstream and per cable upstream for each of the CadPCAdmCtlPriorities. For 1D:8U CAMs, the ifTypes populated are 128(downstream) and 129(upstream). For DOCSIS 2.0 CAMs (2D:12U), the ifTypes covered are 128(downstream) and 205(logical upstream).

cadPCInterfaceAdmCtlEntry.name: cadPCInterfaceAdmCtlEntry
cadPCInterfaceAdmCtlEntry.description: This entry contains all of the default PacketCable admission policy data.

cadPCInterfaceAdmCtlPriority.name: cadPCInterfaceAdmCtlPriority
cadPCInterfaceAdmCtlPriority.description: Priority value assigned to this row.

cadPCInterfaceAdmCtlAllowedUsage.name: cadPCInterfaceAdmCtlAllowedUsage
cadPCInterfaceAdmCtlAllowedUsage.description: Maximum percentage of resources that may be used by requests at the corresponding priority level. This is also the maximum amount of resources non-exclusively allocated to sessions of this type

cadPCInterfaceAdmCtlReservedUsage.name: cadPCInterfaceAdmCtlReservedUsage
cadPCInterfaceAdmCtlReservedUsage.description: Minimum percentage of resources that may be used by requests at the corresponding priority level. This is also the maximum amount of resources exclusively allocated to sessions of this type. If the value of this object is non-zero, then a portion of the bandwidth will be set aside for this priority only - reducing the bandwidth that is available for normal data.

cadPCCAMCblMacEntry.name: cadPCCAMCblMacEntry
cadPCCAMCblMacEntry.description: This entry contains all of the PacketCable data that is to be managed on a per-mac domain basis.

cadPCCAMCblMacIfIndex.name: cadPCCAMCblMacIfIndex
cadPCCAMCblMacIfIndex.description: Indicates whether the authorization module will allow a DOCSIS MAC Messaging Dynamic Services request (DSx) without a gate-ID in an authorization block.

cadPCCAMCblMacFreeDSxAllowed.name: cadPCCAMCblMacFreeDSxAllowed
cadPCCAMCblMacFreeDSxAllowed.description: Indicates whether the authorization module will allow a DOCSIS MAC Messaging Dynamic Services request (DSx) without a gate-ID in an authorization block.

cadPCCblMacMaxOverloadDSaCalls.name: cadPCCblMacMaxOverloadDSaCalls
cadPCCblMacMaxOverloadDSaCalls.description: the max number of connections we will allow per 10 second interval when the system cpu is in a normal condition, i.e. no overload.

cadPCCblMacMaxYellowOverloadDSaCalls.name: cadPCCblMacMaxYellowOverloadDSaCalls
cadPCCblMacMaxYellowOverloadDSaCalls.description: the max number of connections we will allow per 10 second interval when the system cpu is in a yellow overload condition.

cadPCCblMacMaxRedOverloadDSaCalls.name: cadPCCblMacMaxRedOverloadDSaCalls
cadPCCblMacMaxRedOverloadDSaCalls.description: the max number of connections we will allow per 10 second interval when the system cpu is in a red overload condition.

cadPCPEPIDHostname.name: cadPCPEPIDHostname
cadPCPEPIDHostname.description: If set to true, the PEP-ID on the COPS connection will set to the currently configured hostname of the CMTS. If false, the PEP-ID will will be set to the local IP address of the COPS connection.
